column4: i'm trying to figure out what is on /dev/sda3 but it won't let me mount it. when i try to mount /dev/sda3 to /mnt/sda3 it says that i must specify a filesystem type
what's the output of 'sudo fdisk -l'
i have 5 partitions.. windows xp is on sda1, ubuntu on sda2, then i have a partition on sda5 for my files... i can't figure out what is on sda3 though
pastebin the output please.
kind of hard to paste it because im on a different computer but hold on
well at any rate if it told you the fs is ntfs then you'll need this bot factoid. !ntfs
http://pastebin.com/NsNpbSzU
but /dev/sda1 is an NTFS file system and it mounts its self automatically
ok, what command are you trying to use to mount it? (and I assume you made an empty directory to mount into)
im about to format /dev/sda3 but i want to make sure there is nothing important on it first
sudo mount /dev/sda3 /mnt/sda3
sudo mount /dev/sda3 /mnt/sda3 -t ntfs
http://pastebin.com/dE31UV48
hmmm..
quite possible
i have no idea what is on sda3
neither do I, and it doesn't look like it's going to be easy to find out either.
it says it is 2996122+ blocks.. how many gb is that?
2GB maybe? could have been your swap partition at some point
it's probably an old swap partition that you did "something" to lol
oh well what ever it was its gone now.. i deleted it
excellent, it worked ty
